attributes.action: Summon UK ambassador to Sudan due to MilitaryCouncil/RSF human rights violations
attributes.additional_details: UN nations, AMNESTY and several Sudanese local human rights organizations as well as international media (Aljazeera, BBC and CNN) have reported and confirmed the evil killing of peaceful protesters, raping of men and women, attacking innocent civilians at random. The military council and RSF want to illegally rule Sudan and blocking the civil/ elected government from running the country, Knowing that the RSF has long history of war crimes and human rights violations against civilians in Darfur.
attributes.background: Since April coup in Sudan, the military council / and RSF has committed several significant human rights violations reported by local and international organizations including killing of peaceful protesters and throwing their bodies in the Nile, and rapping of women and men at the sit-in area.

rejection.details:
The UK Government has already summoned the Sudanese ambassador regarding the issues you raise. We are therefore unsure what further action you would like it to take.

You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/236102
